FlavorTextOption.Text:
Com sua vitória sobre o Drengin, a humanidade recuperou o que era seu por direito, e ensangüentou o nariz de um inimigo odiado.
Mas a Drengin ainda representa uma ameaça incrível. Esta notícia fornecida pelos Altários, de artefatos capazes de acabar com a ameaça Drengin de uma vez por todas, vale a pena investigar.
Apesar de sua incrível força, a frota terrestre não conseguiu proteger a Terra. Os dias sombrios para a humanidade se aproximam...
D.L. Bradley here. That's an impressive fleet you've assembled, General Alan. I see your time behind the Precursor shield has been put to good use.
Your return was perfectly timed. We were running out of room to put the things.
We're a little disappointed we didn't kill off that shield ourselves.
It's about time, Admiral. The people on Earth are ready to make the Drengin pay for their crimes.

I'm glad to see you're finally free. Because now you can help me finally rid the galaxy of the Drengin.
As you seem to have a fleet capable of securing the local sector around Earth, I'll ask you to do that first. I'll take the Crusader back to secure help from the Arceans.
It will be nice to have allies that owe us a favor. I'll see to securing the local sector then.
Do what you will. We can manage without you.

You seem eager, General. Even better, you seem capable. In that case, I have an assignment for you, something that will allow us to finally rid the galaxy of the Drengin. You are ordered to secure the systems surrounding Earth.
While you do that I mean to take the Crusader back to Arcea and protect them against the enemies that hound them there.
If the Arceans can be made into worthwhile allies, it will be worth the effort.
Yes sir. We will secure the local sector, and then take back everything else we have lost.

We did not walk an easy road ourselves, General. We had to cut our way across a quarter of the galaxy, and our losses were not trivial.
And now that I see the capabilities of your fleet, I believe I will leave you to secure the rest of the local sector on your own. We need to return to Arcea. They helped us greatly in our return, and if we hope to crush the Drengin, we will need all the allies we can get.
The people of Earth aren't too interested in the fate of even friendly aliens these days.
Admiral, don't you think we should stop saving these aliens who keep failing us?
I understand that, General. But when we do win this war against the Drengin, we cannot fight everyone. We will need friends at some point.
If you say so.
No I don't, General. But when we do win this war against the Drengin, we cannot fight everyone. We will need friends at some point.
If you say so.

General, multiple Drengin fleets have been sighted approaching Earth. They must have seen the Crusader depart.
They appear to be pretty lightly armed though. They don't know what we've been up to.
Well let's show them, shall we?
They don't know when to quit, these guys.

General, analysis of the debris from that Drengin Exterminator ship suggests it contained a Spore module. We haven't seen those since the fall of the Korath. This one appears to be far more potent however. Any planet struck by such a device would never be able to sustain life again.
Worse, there's another one coming. If it reaches Earth, the cradle of mankind will be wiped out forever.
Better not let that happen then.

General, analysis of the debris from that Drengin Exterminator ship suggests it contained a Spore module. We haven't seen those since the fall of the Korath. This one appears to be far more potent however. Any planet struck by such a device would never be able to sustain life again.
Worse, there's another one coming. If it reaches Earth, the cradle of mankind will be wiped out forever.
Better not let that happen then.
That took care of the second Exterminator ship, General. Our scopes are clear; hopefully they don't have any more of those.
Let's hope so.
That took care of the second Exterminator ship, General. Our scopes are clear; hopefully they don't have any more of those.
Let's hope so.
Hang on. We're getting an incoming message on one of the old diplomatic channels. It's the Altarians!
Put it through.
I wonder what those smug blue chums of ours want now. Put it through.

Humans. I am Ambassador Akari Malara of the Altarian Confederation. I can not tell you how happy we are to see that our cousins have survived these long years behind that shield.
I have something of the utmost importance to discuss with you. Discretion is paramount, however. I must keep this meeting secret from even my own people.
Of course, Akari. How would you like to arrange this meeting?
We have our own world to think about right now, Akari. We'll grant you a meeting, nothing more.

Excellent. There is a particular Mercenary we have contracted, a smuggler of unusual talent. I'll direct him to meet you at Earth now. Once he arrives, he'll be able to tell you where to collect me. It will be a waypoint some distance from Earth.
Thanks. We'll talk to you again soon.

Excellent. There is a particular Mercenary we have contracted, a smuggler of unusual talent. You'll need to find the Galactic Bazaar to make contact with him. Once you do so, he'll be able to tell you where to collect me.
Thanks. We'll talk to you again soon.

Greetings, human. This is The Smuggler. You took your time finding me.
Akari Malara has already retained my services, so don't open your wallets just yet. She's directed me to collect her from a waypoint some distance from here. I'll leave it to you to decide how best I should do that.
We'll do that.
Thanks, Mr. The Smuggler.
I've got Akari Malara on board now, human. Time to bring her back to Earth.
Sure thing, The Smuggler.
Thank you for meeting with me, General Alan. It is good to see humans in person again. The galaxy is better with you in it, I think.
Thanks. It's good to see you again as well.
The Drengin will regret not killing us when they had the chance.

Thank you.
Honestly, I'm amazed at your demeanor, General. I'd have thought your long confinement behind the Precursor Shield would have left you embittered.
Only a little.
Oh, it has. The Drengin will pay for what they've done.

Your desire to seek vengeance against the Drengin is entirely understandable. But is it wise?
I don't mean to speak out of place. But you do not have a monopoly on suffering. Many Altarians have perished at the hands of the Drengin as well. But my people still want nothing but peace. Not vengeance.
Good for you.
Don't tell us how to feel, Altarian.

All right. We've strayed from the news I originally meant to tell you.
The Crusader, the great ship brought back to this universe by D.L. Bradley, is powered by a terrible artifact called the Bane. My people have a history with this artifact. It has lain at the heart of many great calamities throughout our history.
That sounds awful.
Then I'm glad it's in our hands now.

It is. Worse, the presence of the Bane in this universe has awoken other powerful artifacts of the Dread Lords. If these artifacts are combined with the Bane they will together have the power to destroy the galaxy.
We feel this should be prevented.
That sounds reasonable.
Perhaps.

You shouldn't be. The presence of the Bane in this universe has awoken other powerful artifacts of the Dread Lords. If these artifacts are combined with the Bane they will together have the power to destroy the galaxy.
We feel this should be prevented.
That sounds reasonable.
Perhaps.

We are willing to ally with you and help rebuild your civilization. We will need some assistance defending our own colonies, however, but that will be a small matter for a fleet as powerful as yours.
But most importantly, you must promise that you will not pursue any of these Dread Lord artifacts. The Bane is dangerous enough on its own.
Of course we'll help you.
Tell us where these artifacts are first. So we can protect them.

We are willing to ally with you and help rebuild your civilization. We will need some assistance defending our own colonies, however, but that will be a small matter for a fleet as powerful as yours.
But most importantly, you must promise that you will not pursue any of these Dread Lord artifacts. The Bane is dangerous enough on its own.
Of course we'll help you.
Tell us where these artifacts are first. So we can protect them.
That's exactly what I hoped you'd say. Then it's settled. Today, the Altarian and Terran people will forge a new great alliance. May our peoples live forever in peace.
Agreed. May we forever live in peace.
Sure. Sounds good to us.
Your dark side is showing, human. I worry the Thalans were right about you. A shame. This meeting has been such a waste of my time.
Not just yours, Altarian.

Greetings, General Alan. To assist your fight against the Drengin, we've provided you with some credits and research data. Please don't take this as a sleight on your intelligence. We merely wish to help you get back on your feet.
Thanks for your assistance, Akari.
We'll try not to take that as a sleight.

Hello again. We see you still haven't defeated the Drengin in the area. Don't feel bad! You are still regaining your feet on the galactic stage. To help, we'll provide some more credits and research data.
Thanks for your assistance, Akari.
I didn't feel bad until just now. But thanks.

The Drengin still loiter around this sector, human. They must be a stern opponent to delay someone with a fleet as mighty as yours. We'll send you some more credits and research data. Hopefully this will be enough to put you over the top.
Thanks for your assistance, Akari.
Hopefully. I don't know if I can stand any more of your gifts.

We have lost one of our colonies, General Alan! What use is this alliance if you refuse to help protect us?
Enough of this charade. You can expect no further cooperation from my kind. I worry the Thalans were right about you.
Sorry to hear that.
No great loss.

Well done, General Alan. Your work securing the local sector will ensure humanity has a strong foundation for our campaign against the Drengin.
News must have reached Drengi by now. They'll know we're coming for them.
Let's hope so.
Glad to hear it, sir.
